branches.name: LS Electric, LS Industrial Systems (LSIS) Co. Ltd

notes.text: Passwords are not adequately encrypted during the communication process between the XG5000 software and the affected PLC. This could allow an attacker to identify and decrypt the affected PLC’s password by sniffing the traffic.CVE-2022-2758 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: LS Electric is aware of the vulnerability and is developing mitigations. Users of these affected products are recommended to contact LS Electric for additional information.

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
